entries.description: Fighters are masters of combat in all its varied forms. Ranging from disciplined soldiers to grizzled mercenaries, a fighter is a versatile, weapons-savvy warrior who relies on their strength, speed, and understanding of warfare to outlast their enemies in battle.

entries.title: Strength in Arms
entries.description:
Fighters are proficient with a variety of weapons and armors. They train incessantly to improve their martial prowess, mastering techniques that allow them to wield any weapon with deadly effect. The best fighters are adept at switching between weapons and tactics, responding to the flow of battle with flexibility and precision.

Fighters are found in every corner of the world, making their living as guards, soldiers, mercenaries, and adventurers. Their sense of duty often pushes them to the forefront of battles, where they are most at home.

entries.title: Archetypes of the Fighter
entries.description: Fighters follow diverse paths to mastery. Some choose the path of the Champion, focusing on pure combat prowess and physical might. Others walk the path of the Battle Master, becoming strategists who use their knowledge of war to control the battlefield and enhance their attacks. The Eldritch Knight, meanwhile, weaves magic into their fighting style, using arcane arts to augment their martial abilities.

entries.title: Bearing the Battle's Brunt
entries.description: Fighters are often at the front line of any conflict, taking the brunt of the enemy's assault and protecting their allies. They are known for their durability and their ability to withstand punishment that would fell lesser combatants. This ability comes from their exceptional training, iron will, and often from a personal resolve to protect something - a home, a belief, a loved one - that gives them the strength to stand tall when others might fall.

Barbarians are ferocious warriors known for their raw strength and primal fury. Most hail from uncivilized lands, embracing a life away from the bustling cities and the constraints of society. Barbarians tap into their inner beast during battle, channeling primal energies into unmatched combat prowess.

entries.title: Primal Instinct
entries.description:
The Barbarian’s power comes from a deep connection to primal forces. During combat, they can enter a battle trance known as a Rage, which enhances their strength and resilience. The unyielding endurance and savage power unleashed during this state are legendary, allowing the Barbarian to shrug off attacks while striking down their foes with ease.

Barbarians are not simply mindless brutes. They have an affinity for nature, much like a druid, but their connection is much rawer, more visceral. They use their instincts more than wisdom to navigate the wild, relying on gut feelings and natural intuition.

entries.title: Path of the Berserker
entries.description: Many Barbarians choose to follow the Path of the Berserker, one of the most common primal paths. Berserkers give in to the rage within them, becoming superhuman forces of destruction on the battlefield. Their rage pushes them beyond their limits, allowing them to fight tirelessly and relentlessly. It is a dangerous path, however, as it risks losing oneself to the beast within.

entries.title: Defender of the Tribes
entries.description: Barbarians often hail from tribal societies, where their physical might and warrior skills make them natural protectors. They might be tribal hunters, leaders, or even outcasts, driven by a need to protect their people, to earn a place among them, or to seek revenge for a past injustice. Despite their volatile nature, they are fiercely loyal to their tribes and those they consider part of their pack.

Rogues are cunning and elusive individuals who are known for their skill in stealth, cunning, and surprise attacks. They prefer to stay in the shadows, using their sharp minds and quick reflexes to exploit their enemies' weaknesses and strike when least expected.

entries.title: Masters of Subtlety
entries.description:
Rogues rely on stealth, evasion, and strategy rather than brute force. They are experts in a variety of skills, including lock-picking, disarming traps, stealth, and deception. A Rogue is also adept at getting into and out of dangerous situations, and can often turn the tide of a fight with a well-planned maneuver or a cunning trick.

Rogues can be found in all walks of life - as thieves, spies, assassins, adventurers, or even entertainers. Their ability to find and exploit weaknesses makes them invaluable allies and formidable foes.

entries.title: Archetypes of the Rogue
entries.description: Rogues follow various paths that define their unique set of skills and strategies. The Thief archetype is renowned for agility, stealth, and expertise in thievery. Assassins specialize in dispatching their foes swiftly and silently, often striking down their target before they even realize they're in danger. Arcane Tricksters, on the other hand, use magic to enhance their natural cunning and stealth, adding an extra layer of unpredictability to their tactics.

entries.title: Relentless Opportunists
entries.description: Rogues excel at spotting an opportunity and taking advantage of it. Their Sneak Attack ability allows them to deal extra damage when they catch their enemies off guard or have the advantage in combat. With their uncanny knack for survival and tendency to always have an escape plan, Rogues are difficult to corner and even harder to catch.

Wizards are supreme magic-users, defined and united as a class by the spells they cast. Drawing on the subtle weave of magic that permeates the cosmos, wizards cast spells of explosive fire, arcing lightning, subtle deception, brute-force mind control, and much more.

entries.title: Scholars of the Arcane
entries.description:
Wizards are the quintessential scholars of the arcane, devoting years, decades, or even centuries to studying and understanding magic. Their power comes not only from innate talent but also from meticulous study, careful research, and a deep understanding of the principles that govern the universe.

Every wizard carries a spellbook, a tome filled with the formulae for casting spells. It is their most treasured possession, a compendium of their life's work, and a wizard will guard their spellbook with their life.

entries.title: Arcane Traditions
entries.description: The course of a wizard's career is often determined by the choice of their Arcane Tradition. Each tradition represents a different field of magical expertise, offering unique insights and abilities. The School of Evocation, for instance, focuses on spells that manipulate energy or create something from nothing. The School of Abjuration, on the other hand, specializes in protective magic and wards. Other traditions include the enigmatic Illusion, divining Prophecy, reality-bending Transmutation, and many others.

entries.title: Weavers of Reality
entries.description: Wizards hold a unique position among magic-users, as they see magic not just as a power to be harnessed, but as a science to be understood. Their deep knowledge of magic allows them to shape reality itself, rewriting the laws of the universe on a whim. With every spell they cast, every ritual they perform, they push the boundaries of what is possible, ever driven by the pursuit of knowledge and the power that it holds.

Sorcerers carry a raw, untamed power within themselves that lends them their spellcasting abilities. This magic is not a result of rigorous study or strict discipline, but a force that is innate and distinctive to each sorcerer. It is a gift – or a curse – that is often linked to an ancient bloodline infused with the magic of dragons or other powerful creatures.

entries.title: Wielders of Innate Magic
entries.description:
Unlike wizards who learn and study magic, sorcerers are born with it. Their powers are instinctual rather than intellectual. Where wizards have spellbooks, a sorcerer’s ability to cast spells is as natural as breathing or heartbeat. This instinctual nature can make sorcerers more flexible in casting their spells and enables them to manipulate their magic in ways wizards cannot.

Despite this power, a sorcerer's magic is a double-edged sword. It is a part of them, as constant and necessary as breath, but it is also wild and unpredictable, often manifesting in unexpected ways.

entries.title: Sorcerous Origins
entries.description: The source of a sorcerer’s magic can come from a variety of origins. Those with the blood of dragons in their veins may follow the Draconic Bloodline, gaining powers and traits associated with these mighty creatures. The Wild Magic origin represents a sorcerer who is touched by chaos, their spells often producing random and unpredictable effects. Other sorcerous origins include the divine-touched Divine Soul, the otherworldly Shadow Magic, and more, each providing unique abilities and shaping the sorcerer’s magical path.

entries.title: Unleashing the Power Within
entries.description: Sorcerers have a deep connection to their magic, allowing them to tap into it with a level of intuition rather than understanding. They can use their Sorcery Points to manipulate their spellcasting, reshaping a spell’s energy to perform at a higher level, cast quickly, or even be sustained for a longer duration. This raw and flexible magic, combined with their natural charisma, often makes them inspiring and influential individuals, despite the unpredictable nature of their power.

Clerics are intermediaries between the mortal world and the distant planes of the gods. As varied as the gods they serve, clerics strive to embody the handiwork of their deities. No ordinary priest, a cleric is imbued with divine magic.

entries.title: Divine Agents
entries.description:
Clerics are more than mere priests. They are chosen by their gods to inspire and lead, to heal and harm, to support and destroy. Each cleric serves a specific god and carries out their will in the mortal world. This divine connection grants them their spellcasting abilities and makes them a conduit for their god’s power, using divine magic to heal the wounded, smite their enemies, and protect the innocent.

Their faith, their devotion, and their understanding of divine principles enable them to wield these powers. They perform the miracles of the gods, turning faith into tangible, often lifesaving effects.

entries.title: Domains of the Divine
entries.description: Each cleric is associated with a particular domain – an area of life, knowledge, or expertise over which their god holds sway. These domains reflect the nature of the god the cleric serves, providing the cleric with additional powers and abilities. The Life domain, for instance, is associated with healing and vitality, while the War domain is about martial prowess and strategy. Other domains include Light, Knowledge, Trickery, and many more, each with its unique features and abilities.

entries.title: Divine Intervention
entries.description: In desperate circumstances, the cleric can call upon their deity to intervene directly. While such a plea may not always be answered, when it is, the effect can be truly miraculous and change the course of events. The gods do not do this lightly, and only the most faithful and devoted of clerics have a chance of successfully calling for such aid.
